column1: length, but outside off, and he leaves it alone. Crept through to the wicketkeeper
length, straighter, and keeps a bit low, as he shapes up and defends it straight down the wicket
length, angles across him, and he leaves
slightly shorter, and he leans back and tries to pull. Goes off the inside edge, and trickles down towards Shahzad behind the wicket. No pace, and little bounce here...
length, a little wide, and he goes back and drives it towards cover
fuller, wider, and he drives. The man at cover dives away to his right and stops it
outside off, and he goes back to cut, but misses
goes straight with the arm, and he leaves it on a length outside off

FIRST BLOOD! No pace on this ball, bowled from wide of the crease from around the wicket, and dropping a bit short. He tries to cut, but gets an inside edge on to the stumps. Dream start for Afghanistan, getting the experienced Porterfield out this early!
presses forward and defend a length ball pitched just outside off
goes back and punches a straight ball outside off towards extra cover
carrom ball, and he goes back and nudges it towards point
length ball, seams in from outside off, and he presses forward to defend
strays down the pads, and it's an easy leg glance down to fine leg. Gets it fine enough for four!
length, angling in, and he defends off the front foot
length, just on off stump, and he comes forward to defend
good length, just outside off, slanting in, and he comes forward and defends. Holds the pose for a bit as well
width, and he drives it hard, but straight towards the man at point
tossed up, outside off, and he leaves a full ball
plays him off the backfoot, and almost plays the ball off the outside edge on to the keeper. Shahzad cannot control the ball, chance...
goes back and defends again
defends a length ball on off stump from the crease
straight ball, starts from outside off, and he plays inside the line of it
straighter, and this time he is able to defend off the backfoot
length, outside off, and he blocks after pressing forward
length, outside off, and Stirling stretches and leaves

length ball, angles in, and he presses forward to defend. He has overstepped, though, and that leaves Stirling with a free-hit to take advantage of. The replays suggest he was well within the line, actually!
length, and he biffs it down towards long on. Gets enough of the bat, and more... Cleared his front leg, and then simply teed off
length, and he defends as it straightens after pitching on off stump
length, outside off, and he leaves this alone
length, and he punches it towards cover
length ball on the stumps, gets behind the line and blocks
a touch fuller around off, pushes it down the pitch, Mujeeb dives across to stop it
floated around off, pushed back towards the bowler
looked like a googly, comes forward and defends
slightly shorter and wider this time, Balbirnie waits for it before pushing it towards cover
googly, length around off and spinning in, worked towards short fine leg, another maiden for Mujeeb
short of length outside off, comes on the front foot and taps it towards covers, scrambled seam from Dawlat
length around off, gets behind the line and blocks. Solid defence
length around off, comes forward and blocks again, this time towards covers
length, much tighter line this time, just around off stump, blocked on the front foot
length around off, a little bit of extra bounce, Stirling takes off the bottom hand and opens the face to defend it towards point
almost gets it through this time Stirling, length ball with a little bit of width, punches towards covers but a sliding stop prevents any runs
length outside off, watches carefully and lets it go through to the keeper
fuller around off and swept away towards midwicket for a couple, off the mark on his 17th ball and that's also the first runs conceded by Mujeeb
length outside off, pushes at it with hands, gets beaten
fuller on middle and leg, pushes it back towards the bowler

and Mujeeb gets his man finally, the pressure of dot balls has resulted Balbirnie going for a sweep, misses and up goes the finger. Replays, however, show that the impact might have been just outside the line of the off stump

and he goes first ball. A googly from Mujeeb this time, McCollum goes back and across and looks to defend but gets beaten by the turn, struck right in front of the middle stump. An easy decision for the umpire as Mujeeb has his third
length around off, comes forward and offers a solid defence
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on once again from the front foot
length in the corridor, comes forward before leaving it alone
a touch fuller this time, driven towards mid-off but straight towards the fielder
short of length around off, defended back towards the bowler
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards square leg
length on the pads, turns it towards square leg
carrom ball around off, Stirling was playing for the spin and misses it altogether, that looked plumb but the umpire thinks otherwise
length outside off, Stirling pushes at it and gets beaten as the ball spins away from him
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
length outside off, looks to drive and gets an outside edge, no slip in place though. Mujeeb cuts it off at the third man boundary
length outside off, flashes hard at it but fails to make any connection
length around off, angling in towards the batsman this time, defended on the front foot
length around off, comes forward and works it towards sweeper cover
length around off, a little bit of movement away from the batsman who looks to cut and gets beaten
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, lunges forward and pushes it on the off side
length on the stumps, goes down and sweeps it towards short fine leg
fuller and wider from Mujeeb, Stirling comes forward and drives it past the mid-off fielder
flatter around off, defended from the front foot
a touch fuller around off this time, turns it towards short midwicket
short of length around off, stays in the crease and taps it towards square leg
short of length outside off, cuts it past the diving point fielder who got a hand to it, sweeper cover tidies it up
length around off, comes forward and punches it towards extra cover
length around off, steered towards sweeper cover
length outside off, worked towards sweeper cover for one more
length around off, goes back and works it towards backward square leg, in the gap and will get a boundary for it
length around off, a bit of turn straightaway, Stirling was looking to work it on the leg side, misses and is struck on the pads. Perhaps was missing the leg stump
slower around off, leans forward and works it towards long-on
length around off, KOB gets across and helps it with the turn towards square leg
length outside off, punches it towards short midwicket
slower in the air once again, some turn from the surface as well to beat the front foot defence, but the impact was outside off
length around off once again, drives it towards long-on for a single
short of length outside off, drops it towards point and looks for a single, not available
slower one outside off, a legcutter. Stirling waits for it before hitting but straight to the point fielder
length on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
length, angling in towards the batsman from the off stump, the batsman looks to defend, gets an inside edge past the stumps
slower one around off once again, cuts it towards point
another legcutter around off, comes forward and punches but straight to extra cover
length around off, goes down and paddle it fine for a couple
length outside off, goes back and cuts but cannot beat the man at short third man
length around off, tapped towards square leg off the back foot
length around off once again, too close to cut, spins back to hit the batsman on the glove
length around off, goes back and across and pushes it towards short midwicket
length around off, defended back towards the bowler

chipped straight to mid-on. KOB departs as Asghar takes one of the easiest catches. Coming to the ball, it was once again a legcutter, KOB had to wait for it but could get neither power nor the elevation as the fail hits near the bottom of the bat
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, stays in the crease and blocks
length but way outside off, left alone
fuller and much closer this time, goes for the drive, gets an outside edge but well away from first slip
length around off, waits for it before punching it towards sweeper cover
short of length outside off, punches it towards cover-point
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
length on middle and leg, flicks it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, steers it towards the right of the point fielder for a quick single
length around off, goes back and taps it towards short midwicket
length around off, lunges forward and blocks
length around off, flicks it towards square leg for one
length around off, defended towards short midwicket from the back foot
length around off, keeps a bit low as well, pushed towards covers
short of length outside off, stays back and runs it down towards third man
slower one, way outside off, goes for the cut but it keeps quite low and sneaks underneath the bat
short of length outside off, left alone
and beats the bat straightway with a quick legbreak, length around off, the batsman comes forward to defend and gets beaten as the spins away slightly
a touch fuller this time, around off, defended on the front foot
fuller around off once again, turns it towards square leg
pitched up just outside off, blocks it once more
fuller around off, very watchful, nudges it towards square leg
length around off, dabs it past point for a single
length ball, on off, and he defends
length ball, turns into him slowly, and he defends from the crease
goes back and punches a length ball with the turn down to long on
goes across the line to a length ball outside off. It skews in the air, but drops short of midwicket, who was stationed three-quarters of the way to the boundary
length, outside off, and he cuts it away towards point
length, goes back and covers the turn to punch it back towards the bowler
length ball, presses forward to push it towards point
length ball, presses forward and defends a ball turning into him
length ball, goes straight on again, and he presses forward and defends
big turner, away from him, and beats his outside edge after pitching on a good length. He didn't know much about it
bowled at pace, and skids on with some turn away from him as he pokes forward
length ball, turns away, and he again gets drawn into looking to poke tentatively. Beats the outside edge again
length ball, and he defends it from the crease
shorter, turns from outside off, and he goes back and punches it with the tide towards long on
tossed up, length ball on off, and he presses forward to defend
straghter, and this time he shuffles across and whips it off his pads to square leg
length, and he goes back to punch it, but cannot beat short midwicket
length ball, on off stump, and he pushes it towards point off the backfoot
length, outside off, and he stretches to leave
tossed up, outside off, and he presses forward to defend with a dead bat
short, and he plays it dead from the crease
tossed up, turns away from a length, and takes the outside part of the bat. Well played in the end, as he softened his grip, and ensured the ball ran along the ground past first slip
presses forward to defend a length ball

sharp turn away from a good length. That was tossed up, but also goes through quicker after pitching. Good use of the wrists in imparting some overspin, as it fizzes past the outside edge as Stirling stretches to defend this one
length, and he walks across the crease and plays it with the turn towards deep backward square leg
flighted, and he drops it down the ground towards long on, all along the ground
length ball, and he pushes it down to long on
length, outside off, and he pushes it away towards backward point
presses forward and defends a length ball straight back to the bowler

length, and he plays from the crease, and he's been given leg-before! Good, consistent bowling from Nabi pays off, just pitching outside off and turning back in. Struck him in line, as he was stretching forward to meet it. Looks like it may have gone on to clip middle and leg. Breaks what was turning into a useful little resistance, as Stirling continues to lose partners!
length ball, and he paddles it away after fetching it from outside off. Man down at fine leg gets around to the ball, but lets it go through his hands!
goes back to a length ball and flicks it towards midwicket
short, and he goes back to meet it, and plays it towards short midwicket
quicker one, and he goes back trying to cut it, but it goes through under his bat and through to Shahzad
wrong 'un, that starts from outside off, and he goes back to cut it down to backward point
quicker leg-break, that starts from outside off, and he goes back to cover the turn and defend it
length, outside off, and beats the outside edge as he looks to defend off the front foot. Held its line
fuller, and he drives it down the ground towards long on
tossed up, and he fetches it from outside off and flicks it towards short midwicket
short, and turns into him, slowly, and he can push it past the man at cover
slow, outside off, and he can push it towards point with soft hands and call his partner through for a single
length, outside off, and keeps low. He looks to go back and push it towards cover, but it comes off the bottom edge of the bat and drops down just below the bat
length, straighter ball, and he plays it towards short midwicket
shorter, outside off, and he goes back to punch it towards backward point
length, and turns away from him, bowled slightly quicker, and he goes back to defend it straight back down the pitch
presses forward to defend a length ball pitched just on off stump
turns back in from outside off, bowled at good pace, and Stirling plays it off the back foot towards covers
presses forward to meet a length ball just outside off
length ball. that he gets to dip back off the seam. Poynter plays it off the back foot, and almost chops it back to the stumps. They run through for a quick single, but close shave there!
length, cutting back in, and he plays him defensively off the front foot
fuller, on leg stump, and he drives it uppishly back down the wicket. Just to the left of Zadran in his follow-through
length, and he presses forward to punch it towards extra cover
length, and he presses forward to defend this ball, as it cuts in from outside off
length, but outside off, and he goes back to punches it towards backward point
outside off, and turning further away, and beats the outside edge as the batsman looks to force him through the off side
quick, straight, and he's forced to defend
shape of off-spin, from a length, and he plays him late around towards square leg
length, turning away after pitching, and he plays it down the wicket back to the bowler
tossed up, outside off, and he is lured into a half-drive. Outside edge, but goes along the ground towards short third man
shape away after pitching on off, and he presses forward to defend, and the ball zips past his outside edge
full, straight, and he looks to whip it away towards midwicket, but short midwicket cuts it diving away to his right

ANOTHER ONE FOR AFGHANISTAN! Length ball, cutting back in, and he shuffled across and tried to play it away on the on side, but played all around that one. Raps him on the pads, and he is given out leg before
full but strays on to the pads, and he can tuck it away towards backward square leg
length ball, seaming back into him from outside off, and he plays a flowing drive, but straight towards cover
short, and he can biff it down towards fine leg. Again, the lack of pace on the ball is palpable
length, seaming in from middle towards leg, and he defends it from the crease
tossed up, and he drives it down towards long off
length, outside off, and he plays it late towards third man. They've sent a throw in from third man and are looking to refer this if he made his ground...It's a direct hit, but he was well in
length, and he plays it off his legs. He wants one, but he is sent back by Stirling. The man at square leg needs to pick this up, but cannot collect it cleanly
length ball, and he stretches forward to defend it
length, straight ball, and he defends
length, and he goes back and defends it towards square leg
tossed up, and he drives it with the turn from outside off towards extra cover
tossed up, and he stretches forward to drive. Gets it uppishly going towards point
outside off, and he presses forward to defend this
tossed up, outside off, and he drives it towards short cover
short, turns away from him, and he goes back and cuts it down towards backward point
goes on to the backfoot and punches a length ball towards point
length ball, and he stretches to meet this in front of off stump
stretches to smother a length ball on off stump
carrom ball, on off stump, and he comes forward to defend it
outside off, and he flicks it after stretching, but can't beat short midwicket
drives it down the ground to long on
presses forward to defend a length ball on off stump
tossed up, outside off, and he drives it down towards extra cover. Quick running between the wickets ensures they can pick up two for this
tossed up, and he drives it towards short cover
tossed up on off stump, he takes it on the full, but cannot get it past short cover
short, wide, and he executes a good cut. Rashid Khan at point cannot cut this off, and that is FIFTY for Stirling!
tossed up, and he defends after pressing forward
tossed up, and he drives it. Goes along the ground, but through a gap between short cover and point
length, outside off, and he runs it down towards third man
length ball, on off stump, and he defends it from the crease
length ball, and he defends from the crease
slower ball, and he waits, and waits, and waits, and then drops it at his feet
length ball, slower through the air again, and he defends off the front foot
slower ball, bowled from the side of the hand, and he defends
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it back towards the bowler
carrom ball, quicker outside off, beats the bat as the batsman pushes at it
fuller on the pads this time, tucked away behind square
fuller on the stumps, defended on the leg side
flatter and quicker outside off, beats the forward defence
length outside off, swipes it behind square to rotate the strike

length around off, steered towards the left of backward point for a quick single but slips after a couple of steps, Najib was quick to the ball but Stirling was back in his crease before the throw came in
another slower one, Stirling was looking to come down and misses altogether, gets hit on the pads as he looks to flick it. A loud appeal but the impact was outside off
slower length ball outside off, Stirling looks to smash it away but was way too early into the shot, no connection
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
slower one on the pads, flicked towards square leg for one more
length around off, comes forward and defends it on the leg side
fuller around off, backs away and lofts it over extra cover for a six
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, turns it towards square leg
length around off, pushed back towards the bowler
length around off, comes forward and blocks again
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, goes for the drive but fails to keep it down. Luckily it goes between cover and point
fuller around off, lunges forward and guides it towards short third man
flatter and quicker outside off, left alone
fuller outside off, goes down and steers it towards sweeper cover
a googly this time, length outside off, waits for it before dabbing it towards slip
length around off, goes back and works it towards point
length around off, slower through the air, defended from the front foot
length around off, big turn as the batsman was shaping up for a cut, ends up playing it on to his pads
short of length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover this time
slower in the air, length outside off, goes down on one knee, waits for the ball to come before tapping it towards fine leg
flighted outside off, Stirling goes down the track and lofts this one over long-on for a big six
short of length outside off, rocks back and forces it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
fuller around off, sweeps it firmly towards wide long-on, the fielder puts in the chase but fails to get down and flick it back. That should have been stopped
fuller around off, pushed towards covers
fuller on the stumps again, digs it out back towards the bowler
a googly but way too short, pulls it towards short fine leg
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
short of length outside off, stays in the crease and punches it towards sweeper cover
short of length outside off, pulls it towards short midwicket but straight, the fielder makes a sliding stop to his left. Rashid Khan the fielder there
fuller outside off, goes for an aerial shot but loses his shape and ends up slicing it towards sweeper cover, well short though
in the blockhole, digs it out towards cover-point
length outside off, watches it on to his bat and guides it towards third man
length around off, steers it towards point
length around off, comes forward to defend, gets a thick outside edge towards point
a low full on off, driven towards wide long-on for a couple
length around off, comes forward and turns it towards midwicket
short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it towards deep square leg
length outside off and spinning away, left alone

length outside off, down the track and smashed past the bowler, Najib makes a brilliant stop at long-on to keep it to two, the umpires are checking if the stop was clean. Bu looks like his left foot just touched the rope as he was getting up
short of length outside off, pulled towards deep square leg for two more, Zazai with the slide this time
a full toss on the off the stump, chips it towards long-off
dragged short outside off, Stirling rocks back, accepts the freebie and pulls it way over deep midwicket for a maximum
fired in at the stumps, pushed back
once again in the blockhole, Stirling digs it out on the off side
fuller around off, goes down and slog-sweeps it towards deep midwicket, one bounce and over the rope
fuller again, Dockrell looks to repeat the shot but mistimes it towards long-on
length around off and middle, tucked away towards midwicket

finally Rashid has a wicket. It was pitched short, Dockrell's eyes lit up and he went for a big pull but the ball didn't bounce much and sneaked under his bat to clatter into the stumps. That brings an end to a 76-run stand off just 92 balls
length around off, googly this time, comes forward and works it towards short fine leg
fuller outside off, looks to drive and misses, a big appeal for caught behind by umpire Ravi is unmoved
length ball on the stumps, pushes it back towards the bowler
length outside off, dabs it towards covers for a quick single
length outside off, looks to run it down but ends up playing inside the line
a brilliant yorker at the stumps, McCarthy was moving across and fails to get his bat down in time, gets struck right in front
another yorker but Murtagh does well to get his bat down in time
length ball, angling in to the left-hander to hit him on the pads, the batsman was deep in the crease and the ball struck him in front of middle and leg. An easy decision for the umpire
fuller on the stumps, pushes it on the leg side
length around off, comes forward and defends
googly, length on middle and leg and spinning down, hits the batsman on the thigh
length outside off, left alone
length around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, goes back and pushes it towards covers and keeps the strike
length ball, down the track and lofts it over mid-off, clears with ease
cheeky this time, fuller on the stumps, Stirling moves across and scoops it over short fine leg, almost a six there
fuller around off, drives it towards mid-off, takes the single
fuller on the stumps and swung away towards deep square leg, no one there and gets a boundary
short of length, angling towards the batsman who takes his eyes off and offers the bat, luckily the ball hits the middle of the willow
slower one outside off, cuts it towards point
slower one outside off, should have been a wide if the batsman hadn't gone closer to the ball
this time it is wide, another slower one but further away form the batsman who didn't move much this time
Stirling was already standing outside off and moved further across in expectation of wider one but Naib bowls it on middle and leg and Stirling can just watch it clatter into the stumps
length ball, looks to drive it, and almost chops it on to his stumps
length ball, outside off, and he runs it down towards third man
length ball, and he looks to drive it, the bat skews in his hands and stops on him a bit. He can defend it off the crease
length ball, straight at the stumps, and he defends
length ball, straight at the stumps, and he defends
length ball, straight at the stumps, and he defends
short of a length, and he has to rise to defend this
cuts into him from a length and he defends to the on side
length ball, outside off, and he defends
great ball, just outside off, moves away, and beats his outside edge
length ball, outside off, and he defends
drives a length ball straight back down the wicket
length ball, angles across him, and he defends
opens his account with a six, length ball around off and smashes it over long-on
length ball, and he defends it
length ball, angles across him, and he punches it towards cover
slower one, offcutter from Murtagh, Zazai went for the pull but was too early into the shot, no connection
length around off, defended back without much footwork
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it hard, a thick outside edge flies towards third man
fuller around off, steers it towards backward point
short of length on middle and leg, jumps in the air and dabs it towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards extra cover
short of length around off, gets on his toes and works it towards the left of backward point
short of length on the pads, Zazai misses the flick as the ball brushes the thigh and rolls towards short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, was looking to drive on the leg side, gets a thick outside edge towards covers
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length on the pads, flicks it towards deep square leg for a single
length around off, goes back and pulls it behind square leg for four
short of length, some more room outside off and this one has been clubbed towards deep midwicket, same result
fuller and wider this time, looks to drive through extra cover but doesn't get his timing right
length ball, and he lofts this ball over mid on. Couple of bounces, and into the fence...
length ball, and he drives it back towards mid off
short, and he goes back and punches it. Goes straight to short cover
length ball, he makes room and tries to biff this down the wicket. It goes off the outside edge, and runs down towards third man. Eludes point
length ball, outside off, and he looks to go down the ground. Gets the outside of the bat as it runs down to the third man boundary. Important early runs these...
length ball, jumps off a length, and he defends after jumping up on his toes
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, outside off, and he goes back and cracks a straight ball right off the middle, but cannot beat the man at cover
tossed up, and he waits on it, and then drives towards cover. The ball eludes the first man, who half-stops it, but extra cover comes around to help out
length ball, and he punches it down towards long on with a straight bat
length ball, straight on, and he goes back and shapes to pull. Has to adjust as the ball doesn't turn, and he can only force it away to short midwicket
length ball, he goes back and crashes it towards extra cover
length ball, angles across him, and he drives it towards mid off
length ball, on his pads, and he can work it away with his wrists towards midwicket
length, in his zone, and he goes inside out. Off the outside of the bat, but enough willow on it to clear extra cover. Won't carry to the fence, though
length, he goes for a straight lofted drive, and Porterfield just cannot hold on to it! Dives to his right and gets his fingers to it, but it spills out as he falls
fuller, wider, and he is able to squeeze it out towards third man
length, wider of the stumps, and he drives it towards extra cover
bowled from closer to the stumps, turns it slightly from outside off, and he defends after pressing forward
moves across pre-emptively, and then slogs a shorter ball across the line towards long leg
length, and he presses forward to defend
flighted, fuller, and he drives it from outside off back down to the bowler
shorter, and he goes back and jabs it over midwicket. Shouts of 'Catch it!' but it went over the man stationed there and went down towards midwicket
goes back and punches a length ball towards short midwicket
fuller, but pitches outside leg and strikes him on the pads as he shapes to flick it
short, towards the pads, and he whips it away towards fine leg. The fieldsman sprawls away to his left and saves it
short, wide, and he cuts it from the crease, but cannot beat point
length, outside off, and he cuts it towards point
slower ball, outside off, and he defends it away towards point
another slower ball outside off, and he drops it down the pitch
walks across and meets a length ball and tries to drive it towards midwicket
length ball, and he punches it down to long on from the crease
walks across to the off side and telegraphs his intentions. Simi fires it wider of off stump, and he slashes it away to backward point
fuller, and he plays it from the crease. Takes the outer edge of the bat as it runs away towards point
length ball, he defends it from the crease
length ball, a bit quicker through the air, and he defends from the crease
length, and he runs it down to third man
full ball, angles across him, as he backs away towards the leg side to make some room for himself. Misses out on connection
length, and he cuts it away as it angles across him
length, moves away from him, and he cuts this one wide of point
full, but straying on to the pads, and he can tickle it down towards long leg

SAFE! Length ball, that he wanted to chip down the ground. A slight change of pace means he's early on it, and it scoops up in the air towards cover. Just enough to elude Simi Singh, running across from extra cover
length, angles across him, and he punches it towards covers
fuller, angles across him, and he punches it towards covers. Fielded by mid off, moving away to his right

fuller ball, and he has swung this around, and been taken! He challenges long on, where the fielder stationed is big man Kevin O'Brien, and this is an excellent catch. The ball was sailing over his head, but he caught it, made sure he kept his feet inside the field while taking the catch. Stepped out momentarily for balance, but had already tossed the ball up, and then stepped back in nonchalantly to complete the catch. Big wicket for Ireland, especially in how well timed it is
length, and he flicks it off his pads as it straightens into him. Gets it past short midwicket
fuller, wider, and he throws the kitchen-sink at this again. Gets an inner edge, but the ball runs down towards fine leg
length, straightens into him, and he defends from the crease
length ball, angles into him, and he presses forward to defend this
length ball, on off stump, and he presses forward and drives towards short cover
length ball, slightly slower, and also grips on the surface. Rahmat looks to drive, and it goes off the inside of the bat towards short midwicket
length, and he drives it. It is uppish, but it beats short cover, extra cover, and runs away for four!
length ball, and he presses forward to defend
length, and he presses forward and defends towards point
length ball, nips away off the seam after pitching, and appears to have taken the outside edge...the stump in fact! And the bail didn't fall!
length ball, and he is forced to defend as it seams back into him
lucky! Length ball, outside off, and he tries to swing it towards extra cover, but it takes the inside edge and runs down to fine leg
length ball, and this time there's no doubt he has middled it! Slogs it towards midwicket, and beats long on comfortably
length ball, outside off, and he tries to slog this over midwicket again
length ball, outside off, and he drives it off the back foot
short of length outside off, cuts it towards point, Rahmat Shah was halfway down but Shahzad is unmoved. The throw is wayward and that allows Rahmat to get back in
length delivery, worked towards midwicket for one
fuller around off, comes forward and offers a copybook defence
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
length outside off, steers it towards covers
length around off, punched towards mid-on for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-off for a walking single
length around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, Shahzad swivels and pulls it towards the vacant deep midwicket region for four
fuller around off, skips down and lofts it over the bowler's head, didn't middle it though
flatter on the stumps, comes forward and defenfds
mistime it back towards the bowler
length around off, stays back and punches it towards wide mid-on
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length again, just around off, blocks it from the front foot
length around off, comes forward and defends again
length around off, drives it towards mid-on
length around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
length ball around middle and leg, defended from the front foot
fuller outside off, whipped towards wide mid-off
short of length, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket, one-bounce four
fuller around off, driven towards long-off for a walking single
fuller outside off, Shahzad goes inside out and hits it over extra cover, McCollum puts in the slide from sweeper cover but he was in contact with the rope while trying to flick the ball inside
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
length around off, stays in the crease and defends it towards covers
short of length on the stumps, gets behind the line and blocks
fuller around off this time, drives but straight towards mid-off
fuller again, looks to drive but just falling over and the ball rolls towards square leg
short of length around off and middle, defended from the back foot
length around off, stays back and defends
short of length outside off, pulls it towards midwicket for a couple
back of length around off, steered towards cover-point
short of length outside off, punched towards mid-off off the back foot
length on the middle and leg, flicked towards fine leg
fuller on the stumps and driven past mid-on with a straight bat, the ball races away for the boundary
length around off, comes forward and defends
length outside off, Rahmat pushes at it and gets beaten as it moves just away from the batsman
short of length outside off, looks to punch it through covers, the ball hits the inner half and rolls on the leg side
fuller around off, driven back towards the bowler
length around off, looks to run it down but misses
short of length outside off, steers it towards third man
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards deep midwicket
fuller around off, Shahzad extends his arms to loft it over mid-off for four
short of length outside off, looks to steer it past the keeper, misses
length this time, Shahzad once again looks to go over mid-off but this time he is not to the pitch of the ball and ends up mistiming it, Murtagh pedals back from mid-off to complete a good catch
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, spinning away and takes the outside edge but goes away from slip and along the turf
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, Shahidi plays inside the line and gets beaten
length around off, goes back to punch but ends up chopping it into the ground
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
back of length around off, dead-bats it from the back foot and it nearly rolls on to the stumps, just missing the off stick
fuller and wider outside off, left alone
short of length on the body, swivels to pull but ends up pulling it up in the air towards square leg, Simi Singh charges in, dives forward and takes it inches off the ground
short of length around off, rises on his toes and defends it towards cover-point
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, digs it out towards the bowler
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller again, pushed towards covers from the front foot
length around off, punches it back towards the bowler
fuller around off, blocked from the front foot
length around off, defended on the front foot once again
length around off, stays back this time and defends with a straight bat
starts with a wide down the leg side
flatter on the stumps, lunges forward and blocks
length on the stumps, keeps a bit low, blocked from the back foot
length but angling on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg for a couple
flatter on the stumps, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
flighted outside off, goes for the drive but finds extra cover
length around off, defended from the crease
fuller and driven but short mid-on cuts it off
tossed up around off, lunges forward and pushes it towards short extra cover
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards short fine leg
length around off, stays back and defends it on the off side with soft hands
flatter on the stumps, taps it towards cover-point from the back foot
length around middle and spinning a bit to beat the bat, an appeal for lbw but was going down perhaps
length around off and middle, tucked away towards square leg
length on the stumps, defends it down the wicket
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length around off, rocks back and pulls it towards deep midwicket to take the side past 100
short of length around off, punched towards covers off the back foot

fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover and sets off, a bit of fumble there by the fielder who swoops low and underarms it towards the bowler. Simi breaks the stumps but by then Naib was home
length on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, flicked away but nicely by short mid-on, diving to his right
length around off, goes deep and blocks
slower ball, cuts across him, and he pushes forward to defend, and it just beats the outside edge
length ball, angles across him, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, angles across him, and he drops it defensively towards point
length ball, he takes a couple of steps forward and then jams down on it as it angles into him
length ball, keeps a bit low, but he adjusts as he defends from the crease
length ball, he advances again, but can only play it away to point
length ball, and he sweeps it off middle stump towards midwicket
goes back and punches a length ball towards square leg

beauty of a ball! This is pitched up, just outside off stump, and invites a tentative poke from Shahidi, and just takes a feather-edge on its way through to Poynter, who holds on. The Irish team celebrates, as this breaks what was looking like a useful association after two quick wickets
length ball, and he plays it towards midwicket
run-out chance missed! Presses forward to flick a ball from outside off, and it is fielded at midwicket. Naib comes halfway down the track, but the return to his end is poor as he is sent back
full ball, that he defends
length ball, and he presses forward to defend this one, pitching on off stump
length, angles into him, and he plays it off his legs towards square leg
length, coming back into him, and he presses forward and drives it back down the pitch
length ball, and he punches it towards short cover
length ball, just outside off, and he drives it back down towards the bowler
length ball, he plays a drive on the up, and it just clears mid off
length ball, and he presses forward and defends a ball turning into him from off stump
length ball, delivered from closer to the stumps, and he defends
shorter, and he goes back and punches it against the turn, but cannot beat short cover
length, but strays on to the pads, and he goes back and flicks it towards long leg
fuller ball, and he drives it towards midwicket. Well intercepted by a man who fields at short mid on
tossed up, outside off, and he drives it back down the wicket
length ball, angles back in from outside off, and he defends from the crease
length ball, but straighter, and he can punch this away towards long leg. He wants two, but they decide against taking on the fielder from deep backward square
length, outside off, and he punches it towards the bowler. It is to the right of mid on, who dives to his right, and then has a shy at the non-striker's end
length ball, outside off, and he drags it from there and tries to clear mid on. It falls just short of Boyd Rankin there. Good attempt, but no wicket off that
length, moves back in off the seam, and he defends from the crease
shorter in length and he can nurdle this one down to fine leg
length ball, tossed up, and he drives it towards short cover
tossed up, and he drives it straight back down the wicket
length, but down the leg side, and he flicks it down towards long leg
length, and he presses forward to meet a ball tossed up outside off
length, and he opens the face of the bat and runs it towards point. Kevin O'Brien does well to stop it, stretching away to his left
length, and he pushes it back to the bowler
length ball, a bit slow, and he is early into a pull from the crease. Hits him on the pad, and there's a huge appeal, but it was probably sliding down leg all along
length, and he whips it away from outside off, towards midwicket. Good shot, and an important pressure release!
length, and he goes towards midwicket again. The length has just been a bit full, and Naib is taking full toll, and easing the pressure off his team...
length, straighter, and he defends from the crease
fuller again, and he whips it away towards midwicket yet again. An action replay of the previous two boundaries almost!
length ball, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, on middle, and he looks to drive. Gets the inner part of the bat, as it goes towards mid on
flatter, lower, and going towards the leg stump, and he goes back to defend
length, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, and he presses forward and eases it towards point
length ball, comes back with the natural angle from around the wicket, and he presses forward to defend this one
length, outside off, and he drops it towards point
length ball, and he goes back to flick it towards midwicket
length ball, and he glances it to fine leg
length ball, and Naib fetches it from outside off and biffs it away just in front of square on the on side. Top shot!
full ball, on off stump, and he drives it back towards the bowler

fuller, and he flicks this one away between fine leg and deep backward square leg. The fielder there chases it down to his left, and then stops the ball even as he lies sprawled on the field. Excellent commitment!
length ball, and Afghan comes forward to defend, and it just gets his bat. Might have been in trouble had that missed the blade. The ball trickles away towards short cover
fuller, down the leg side, and he can nudge this down towards fine leg
length, straight ball, and he defends from the crease
length, and he presses forward to defend
length, coming back in with the angle, and he defends from the crease
length, and he presses forward to ease the ball past the bowler down to long off
in the slot, just outside off, and he whacks it towards long on. Great shot, as Naib begins to hit his stride in the last 3-4 overs
a chance goes begging! It was short, and he whipped it away cross-batted, towards midwicket. Dockrell got the ball in his fingers, but couldn't hold on
length, outside off, lifting a bit, and he defends off the crease
length, outside off stump, and he goes back into his crease and cross-batted swats it back towards the bowler. It goes on to beat mid off, but the fielder from mid on gets across to it

he's connected with this! Just a bit full in length, at the stumps, but he steps away and then just hammers it down towards midwicket. Elevation, distance, and timing....this had the complete package!
full toss, and he has tickled it down to fine leg. It could also be called a no-ball, because it was definitely a full toss above waist height. Not called a no-ball, though!
full, but towards his pads, and he can move inside the line and flick it away towards midwicket

there won't be a fifty for Naib! Tossed up, and pitched on leg stump, and Naib was looking to just work it towards midwicket. Got the leading edge and floated back towards Dockrell, who clings on gleefully. An effective knock from Naib comes to an end, with the final acceleration probably doing enough to seal this deal for Afghanistan
length, and he has biffed this straight down the ground, over long on! What a start!
length, outside off, and he hits it hard again, but cannot get it past deep mid off
full, and he tonks this over midwicket. Victory for Afghanistan, and with an emphatic slog sweep by the birthday boy!
